name: Sample Space
description:
The collection of possible outcomes of an experiment is called the sample space denoted by $\Omega$. Any subset $A\subseteq \Omega$ is called an event. We define $\emptyset$ to be the impossible event and $\Omega$ itself to be the inevitable event.

A sample space can be continuous (i.e. $\mathbb{R}$) or discrete (i.e. $\mathbb{Z}$), and it can also be bounded (a closed set) or unbounded (an infinite set). This is the basis behind our theory of probability.
